intro: Hieracium viscosum subsp. euoxygonoides, commonly known as the sticky hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and hairy, sticky leaves. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its subspecies euoxygonoides is distinguished by its more elongated leaves and slightly different floral structure compared to other members of the species. It plays a role in supporting pollinators and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
